requirements.summary: Add an "Index Performance" snapshot to the Dashboard showing % change for a fixed set of indices, sorted descending by % change.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard includes an "Index Performance" section visible above or alongside the existing Bull/Bear scan results.
The section displays one row per index from the provided list.
Each row includes the index name and its current % change value.
Rows are sorted by % change in descending order (highest % change at the top).
All user-facing labels in this section are in English.

file_operations.description: Extend the frontend backendInterface type definitions with the new backend capability used to fetch the Dashboard index performance payload (name + numeric % change + explicit missing value), so the frontend can compile cleanly once the backend implements it.

Add a React Query hook that fetches the index performance payload from the actor (enabled only when the actor is ready) and returns loading/error/data states suitable for rendering and client-side sorting.

Create an Index Performance snapshot component that renders one row per required index, formats % change (and an English "Unavailable" state when missing), and sorts rows by % change descending before display. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new IndexPerformanceSnapshot into the Dashboard UI above or alongside the existing Bull/Bear scan results (without changing existing scan logic/results tables), ensuring all labels are English and the section is visible in the main dashboard layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
